trans-unit.source: Converts <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> objects from one data type to another.
A type converter is used to convert values between data types.
A type converter also supports property configuration at design time by providing text-to-value conversion or a list of values that users can select from.
Access the FontConverter class through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class by calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.FontConverter"></xref> object.
You should access a <xref:System.Drawing.FontConverter> object through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Determines whether this converter can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type of the converter.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The type you want to convert from.
This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this object can perform the conversion.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref uid="langword_csharp_ITypeDescriptorContext" name="ITypeDescriptorContext" href=""></xref> object that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> object that represents the type you want to convert to.

This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the specified object to the native type of the converter.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_CultureInfo" name="CultureInfo" href=""></xref> object that specifies the culture used to represent the font.
The object to convert.
The converted object.
The conversion could not be performed.
Converts the specified object to another type.
The most common type conversion is to and from a string type.
The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method of the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object that specifies the culture used to represent the object.
The object to convert.
The data type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
The conversion was not successful.
Creates an object of this type by using a specified set of property values for the object.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.
A dictionary of new property values.
The dictionary contains a series of name-value pairs, one for each property returned from the <xref:System.Drawing.FontConverter.GetProperties*> method.
The newly created object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object could not be created.
The default implementation returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
CreateInstance useful for creating non-changeable objects that have changeable properties.

Allows the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontConverter"></xref> to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the <xref href="System.Drawing.FontConverter"></xref> is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Determines whether changing a value on this object should require a call to the <xref:System.Drawing.FontConverter.CreateInstance*> method to create a new value.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.

This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref uid="langword_csharp_CreateInstance" name="CreateInstance" href=""></xref> object should be called when a change is made to one or more properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves the set of properties for this type.
By default, a type does not have any properties to return.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.
The value of the object to get the properties for.
An array of <xref:System.Attribute> objects that describe the properties.
The set of properties that should be exposed for this data type.
If no properties should be exposed, this may return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The default implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An easy implementation of this method can call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties*> method for the correct data type.
Determines whether this object supports properties.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.

This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the GetPropertiesSupported method should be called to find the properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
